title.narrative: 2.1 SUPPORT TO ENHANCE OVERALL PREPAREDNESS LEVELS.

related-activity.ref: 456F/F0/10/002 2. CAPACITY (CO, RO & HQ LEVELS) TO PREPARE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: In 2021, RAPS mobilized HQ and RO support to embed preparedness more firmly throughout UNICEF’s work and enhance preparedness capacities of priority, high-risk contexts through innovative funding, tailored technical support, and quality assurance of preparedness and contingency plans. RAPS improved the online EPP platform, expanded strategic partnerships for preparedness, provided efficient technical support and increased investments in preparedness through the First Action and Co-Funding Initiatives – two innovative funding facilities that push resources out before crises to step up preparedness. | Status:Met | As-of Date:23/03/2022

title.narrative: Inter-agency is supported in the roll out and improvement of the IASC Emergency Response Preparedness (ERP) approach, guideline and tools, to ensure alignment and mutual support with UNICEF approach(61086)

baseline.value: Inter-agency supported in the roll out and review of the IASC ERP approach, guideline and tools; alignment with UNICEF could be enhanced

target.value: 2021:Inter-agency supported in the improvement of the IASC ERP and alignment with UNICEF approach

title.narrative: The Emergency Preparedness Platform is fully functional and is improved to meet users(61085), Text

baseline.value: Minimum viable product for the EPP developed (EPP1)

target.value: 2021:EPP is a mature platform, fully functional and meets well user

title.narrative: HQ Divisions, ROs and COs are provided systematic support in enhancing their preparedness levels, with emphasis on countries affected by high risks, as needed(61087)

baseline.value: Support is provided to HQ Divisions, ROs and COs, however it is not systematic

target.value: 2021:Support provided to HQ Divisions, ROs and COs is systematic (follows agreed decision trees)

title.narrative: UNICEF preparedness procedures, guidelines and tools are updated, improved and harmonized with other UNICEF risk management processes(61084)

baseline.value: UNICEF preparedness procedures and guidelines issued in Dec.2016; essential tools updated; some tools and specific guidelines to be developed; harmonization with GRIP is good; harmonization with ERM,

target.value: 2021:UNICEF preparedness procedures and guidelines are completed and harmonized with other UNICEF risk management processes

title.narrative: % RO/CO that contribute to inter-agency ERP roll out at CO level including development of contingency plans for specific risks and contribution to development action(61088)

baseline.value: UNICEF revising and rolling out its own ERP guidance, based directly on the IASC ERP approach 6 No inclusive approach to guarantee the most comprehensive and effective risk analysis process

target.value: 2021:80% RO/CO that contribute to inter-agency ERP roll out at CO level

title.narrative: % of RO/CO contributing to an inter-agency mechanisms and/or focal point on inter-agency Preparedness fora(61089)

target.value: 2021:UNICEF and inter-agency risk analyses, in particular the IASC EWEAR and the IASC ERP, mutually support each other
